result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Raul Sostre Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 10/14/22.

miscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure ot pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
Court ordered this matter be expunged upon successful completion of probation.  If all of the fees have not been paid by the end of probation, matter is still to be expunged.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Raul Sostre Gonzalez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose Raul Sostre Gonzalez in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Jose Raul Sostre Gonzalez.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/14/22.
- Complete 25 hours of community service.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal. 

***COURT ORDERED THIS MATTER BE EXPUNGED UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION***IF ALL OF THE FEES HAVE NOT BEEN PAID BY THE END OF PROBATION, MATTER IS STILL TO BE EXPUNGED***
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Defendant Jose Raul Sostre Gonzalez in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jose Raul Sostre Gonzalez in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz needs to review discovery and offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jose Raul Sostre Gonzalez in court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/08/2022@2:30p
